pageContext.claim: “Bins full of ballots in a dumpster”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, in his continuing effort to spread doubt about the security of the election, posted a video of a report on a United Postal Service employee who was charged with willfully obstructing the passage of mail after more than 100 absentee ballots and other mail was found in a construction dumpster. But the complaint says he tossed all sorts of mail, including approximately 69 mixed class pieces of flat rate mail, 320 second-class pieces of mail, and two national election campaign flyers from a political party in Florida. The 111 general election absentee ballots from the Jefferson County Clerk’s Office were being mailed to voters to be filled out. “An analysis of the mail revealed it was from a single route for one scheduled delivery day,” prosecutors said.
